results.title: Vision. [No. 27]
results.creator_credit: Sidney R Aronson, SA Films and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Senior softball - a softball league whose players are all 75 years of age or older; Busch Gardens - where people enjoy riding, animal shows etc; Hamburger University - the school training thoe who operate McDonald’s restaurants; house-on-the rocks - a ‘castle in the sky’ perched on top of a rugged 450 foot high chimney rock; Harpers Ferry - John Sergem, wood carver, creates plaques, busts and other exhibits for display in national parks; Eva Jessye - one of the great names in Black American music.

results.title: Vision in the forest
results.brief_description: Film trailer on forest fire prevention. While a family enjoys their camping trip in the forest, one of the children wanders away, and sees a vision: a cartoon character, Smokey Bear, comes alive in his fire prevention poster, and lectures on how people can befriend the forest and its wild creatures.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: more angles in a circle
results.brief_description: Explores the problem of placing a triangle of known angles so that it is circumscribed by a given circle. Indicates a method for locating one’s position on a map if three landmarks are recognised.
results.title_for_label: Vision in mathematics: more angles in a circle

results.title: Vision in mathematics: more about Pythagoras
results.brief_description: Develops some ideas arising from the theorum of Pythagoras, including the notion of irrational numbers. Uses the knowledge of Pythagoras’s theorem to calculate the length of a rafter in a roof.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: isosceles triangles
results.brief_description: Discusses the properties peculiar to the isosceles triangle, to allow examination of many theorems involving bisectors, equality and congruence.

results.title: Vision at night
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Royal Air Force and Science Films
results.brief_description: The structure of the eye, and its operation, especially at night: visual purple; rods and cones; scanning; adaptation; pre-adaptation; goggles; the value of special diet for night vision.

results.title: Viruses: threshold of life
results.brief_description: With the aid of complex instruments such as the ultra-centrifuge and the electron microscope, the use of tissue cultures and animal experimentation, we see how scientists in a modern virology laboratory explore the nature of viruses, how these viruses exist and how we can use this knowledge to improve our health and well-being.

results.title: Virginia Woolf: the moment whole (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Alan Raymond, Janet Sternburg and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Introduces the philosophy and literary style of the 20th century writer, Virginia Woolf, by presenting visuals of the milieu in which she worked complemented by selections from “A room of one’s own” and “The waves”, read and portrayed by Marian Seldes.
